title: Sian Massey-Ellis to become first Englishwoman to officiate in men's European fixture
text:
Sian Massey-Ellis will make history this evening when she becomes the first English female to officiate in a men's European fixture.

The assistant referee had entered the historic books back in August when she became the first woman to officiate in the Community Shield.

This evening she joins referee Chris Kavanagh, fellow assistant Dan Cook and fourth official Peter Bankes for the Europa League game between PSV Eindhoven and Linzer ASK.

The match at the Philips Stadium will also be screened live by BT Sport.

“It was really exciting when I found out,” said Sian, regarding her latest appointment to the FA website.
description: Sian Massey-Ellis will make history this evening when she becomes the first English female to officiate in a men's European fixture.
